span.p: Kindergarten Packets for 2020-2021 will be available in the main office after Feb 1, 2020. Kindergarten registration is Tues., 5/19/20 & Wed., 5/20/20 from 1:00 PM - 2:50 PM by appointment. We recommend you schedule your appointment when you pick up the packet.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.span: LINK: Click here to register to receive an invitation code to the virtual meeting on April 30th at 6:00 PM

, the Neptune City School will provide grab and go meal service for its students on Mondays and Wednesdays from 10:00am to 12:00pm only. Meals can be picked up at the exterior Cafeteria door (the white door) facing the parking lot.

span.strong: Meals pick up service will continue during Spring Break on Monday, April 13th and Wednesday, April 15th.

strong.span: Video from the Woodrow Wilson Staff to our Students

p.span: Link: NEPTUNE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC PLAN

br.span: Click above to access individual pages by grade level for assignments and resources for at-home learning.

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.strong: Updated District Health Statement Regarding Coronavirus

span.div: Again, I can't thank you enough for the work that you are doing with your children and the ongoing collaboration and cooperation that is occurring with our teaching and clinical staff. I hope that each of you are safe and healthy during these very challenging times and we look forward to the day that your children can return to school and we all can return to our normal lives.

The third marking period has come to close and the teachers will be entering grades and comments during the first part of the week. The goal is for the third marking period report cards to be completed by Thursday of this week. I know that our teachers will certainly take into consideration the challenges that we all have experienced during the past month when determining your child's grades.

The District was scheduled to go on Spring Break beginning Friday, April 10, 2020 through Sunday, April 19, 2020. Therefore, we will observe the Spring Break as everyone needs to take a much needed "breather" in preparation for the weeks beginning on April 20, 2020. The teachers will resume their remote learning efforts and strategies on Monday, April 20, 2020.

On a positive note, the staff put together a video that will be shared with your children expressing their love for their students and how much they are missed. This link will be forwarded to you by your child's homeroom teacher and I will ensure that it is posted on the District website.

For those families that have been receiving breakfast and lunch provided by the District, the breakfast and lunch service will continue throughout the Spring Break. They can be picked up on Monday and Wednesday at 10:00 A.M near the outside entrance to the cafeteria.

Again, I want to thank each of you for all that you are doing as we work together to overcome this health crisis. I hope that your celebration of the Holy Week and Passover are meaningful and that we all find the faith and strength to overcome this historical crisis. Please be safe and healthy.

p.br:
Ralph P. Ferrie, Ed.D.
Interim CSA, Neptune City Public Schools
